function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Use of an unvalidated test method","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential cross-contamination during testing","category":"Air","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate follow-up period after coating application","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Handling and manipulation of virus samples may lead to accidental exposure and transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of biophilic design, leading to a lack of nature-related features and patterns in the built environment.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient accessibility to nature-related features and spaces, limiting the potential health benefits of biophilic design.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider the impact of biophilic design on airborne disease transmission and contagion within the built environment.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to nature and natural elements in the built environment may lead to a lack of biophilic connections and reduced well-being.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for indoor air quality and ventilation may lead to the spread of airborne diseases.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate maintenance of water features may lead to the proliferation of waterborne diseases and microbial contamination.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of greenery maintenance may lead to the accumulation of allergens, pests, and pathogens, contributing to health hazards.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of explicit design strategies and guidelines for translating biophilic design into architectural design","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of validation for the effectiveness of biophilic design in buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of financial matters and building technology in biophilic architecture","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Integration of ’nature’ in architecture may not effectively mitigate contagious disease propagation","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited evaluation criteria for non-physical architectural themes","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Structural problems and excessive humidity caused by plants in architecture","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insect troubles and odour issues caused by plants in architecture","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for air quality in biophilic design may lead to the spread of airborne diseases.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglecting proper maintenance of plants in buildings can lead to the propagation of pests and disease-carrying insects.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration for the selection of indigenous plant species may disrupt the local ecosystem and increase the risk of invasive species and diseases.","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of ’nature’ into buildings may create conditions for the propagation of contagious diseases.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex architectural shapes requiring higher budgets","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inevitable human error in mimicking nature may cause an unbalanced system","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient investigation of architectural design issues such as form, typology, scale, proportion, and technology","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation and air quality control","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to natural habitats for animals","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Biophilic design could potentially contribute to the spread of contagious diseases through the creation of habitats for animals in urban areas.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of appropriate water management in biophilic design could lead to the proliferation of disease-carrying vectors such as mosquitoes.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variable contribution of architecture to different sustainable development goals sdgs","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases spread in built environments","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close contact in congested areas may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air quality may increase the risk of airborne disease transmission.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of natural elements and outdoor exposure may impact mental health and immune function.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of biophilic design principles leading to inefficient integration of 'nature' in architecture.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of ventilation and natural light in built environment leading to poor indoor air quality and mental health issues.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air circulation in biophilic design buildings leading to poor indoor air quality and increased risk of airborne contagions.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of biodiversity leading to environmental imbalance and disease emergence","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Climate crises, biodiversity loss, air pollution, and other sustainable challenges","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of ventilation in the built environment","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sharing ventilators between 2 patients increases the risk of cross-contamination and spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of improvised breathing aids and devices, such as snood-type masks, without proper filtration and purification systems may lead to inadequate protection against airborne viruses.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Development of makeshift ventilation solutions using off-the-shelf components and 3d printing techniques may pose risks related to device safety, reliability, and function.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Improperly collected, transported, or handled specimens may result in false-negative results in covid-19 tests.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High risk of false-negative results in self-collected at-home covid-19 test kits due to improper sample collection.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced performance due to virus transport medium","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adequate ventilation in home isolation spaces can lead to increased risk of virus spread within the household.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sharing of communal spaces, such as toilets, in households where individuals are advised to isolate at home can increase the risk of virus transmission among family members.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate protective equipment for health care workers can increase the risk of infection while interacting with covid-19 patients.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Safety concerns with reusable masks and shields due to
